title: AIOU to commence admissions in BA, B.Ed. from Sept. 1
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 01 (APP): Allama Iqbal Open University (AIOU) will open admissions for its Teacher Training Programs, including the 1.5-year, 2.5-year, and 4-year B.Ed programs, starting September 1st.
According to AIOU, in addition, the university will offer a range of other programs in the second phase of the Fall 2024 semester, including associate degrees (BA/B. Com), Postgraduate Diplomas, and BS (ODL) programs.
Professor Dr. Nasir Mahmood, Vice Chancellor of the university, highlighted the success of the Faculty of Education’s teacher training initiatives.
He noted that millions of teachers have been trained through these programs, with alumni serving in educational institutions across the country.
“Our trained educators are making a significant impact in schools, colleges, and universities nationwide,” Dr. Mahmood remarked.
The first phase of admissions for the Fall 2024 semester is currently underway. The deadline for Matric, FA, and I.Com program applications is September 5th, while applications for BS (Face-to-Face) programs, MS, MPhil, and PhD programs are due by August 20th.
For further details on admissions, visit the university’s website or contact one of its regional offices across the country.
